title: 108_hr3514
content:
The Pennsylvania National Forest Improvement Act of 2004 includes provisions for the disposal and conveyance of various administrative sites within the Allegheny National Forest in Pennsylvania. This Act also addresses the administration of land acquired by the United States and its relation to other conveyance authorities. The Secretary of Agriculture has the authority to convey National Forest System lands and administrative sites in the Allegheny National Forest, Pennsylvania, through sale or exchange. This includes various tracts such as US Tract 121, Sheffield ranger residence, US Tract 896, an undeveloped administrative site, US Tract 1047, original Marienville Ranger District Headquarters, and US Tract 844, Marienville ranger residence. The Survey Plat prepared by D. M. Heller on December 12, 1999, is the definitive description of lands subject to conveyance under section 5. Maps are the primary descriptions, and in case of conflict with metes and bounds descriptions, the map prevails. The maps are available for public inspection until lands are disposed of. Consideration for land conveyance includes the option to convey other land or improvements to the Secretary, with the possibility of a cash equalization payment exceeding 25% of land value. The conveyance of land under this section is subject to applicable laws and regulations. The Secretary may prioritize public entities for land selection and can set terms for offers. Offers may be rejected if deemed inadequate or not in the public interest. Upon conveyance, any public order withdrawing the land is revoked. The Secretary may impose additional terms and conditions on land conveyances to protect US interests. The Secretary may impose additional terms and conditions on land conveyances to protect US interests, including the conveyance of Sheffield Ranger District headquarters in Warren County, Pennsylvania. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey US Tract 770, Sheffield Ranger District Headquarters, consisting of 5.50 acres, to the Warren County Development Association for a lump sum payment of $100,000. The map titled "Allegheny Unit, Elk Tanning Company Tract 770, 1934" will serve as the primary description of the lands. The map will be available for public inspection until the lands are disposed of. When the Secretary conveys land under this section, any public order withdrawing the land from appropriation under public land laws is revoked. Conveyance of Ridgeway Ranger District Headquarters in Elk County, Pennsylvania. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey US Tract 904 and US Tract 905 to Ridgeway Township, Pennsylvania, for a fair market value determined by an appraisal. The maps depicting the lands will serve as the primary description, available for public inspection until the lands are disposed of. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey US Tract 904 and US Tract 905 to Ridgeway Township, Pennsylvania, for a fair market value determined by an appraisal. The Chief of the Forest Service will oversee the lands until they are disposed of. Upon conveyance of the land, any public order withdrawing the land from appropriation under public land laws is revoked. SEC. 5. Conveyance of Marienville Ranger Residence, Forest County, Pennsylvania. The Secretary of Agriculture may convey, without consideration, to the Marienville Volunteer Fire Department of Forest County, Pennsylvania, all right, title, and interest of the United States in a portion of US Tract 844, Marienville ranger residence. The map titled "Allegheny Unit, Peter B. DeSmet Tract 844, 1936" serves as the primary description of the lands. Any public order withdrawing the land from appropriation under public land laws is revoked upon conveyance. SEC. 6. DISPOSITION OF FUNDS.

The Secretary of Agriculture shall deposit proceeds from sales and exchanges under this Act into the Sisk Act Fund for the Allegheny National Forest's administrative facilities, sites, and land acquisition. Funds deposited are available without further appropriation, with a condition that the market value of acquired lands may not exceed 125 percent of the disposed lands.

SEC. 7. ADMINISTRATION OF LAND ACQUIRED BY UNITED STATES. SEC. 7. Lands acquired by the Secretary of Agriculture under this Act shall be managed in accordance with the Weeks Act and other relevant laws. The boundaries of the Allegheny National Forest will be adjusted based on land disposal and acquisition. SEC. 8. This Act does not affect the Secretary's authority to sell, exchange, or acquire land, except as expressly provided. Lands authorized for disposal under this Act are not subject to certain provisions of the United States Code. Attest: JEFF TRANDAHL, Clerk.
